actionData.title: Demo Action
actionData.message: If this was a real Todo list app, you could connect the banner tap to your 'Create New List' experience with a deeplink.

actionData.title: Goal Already Completed
actionData.message: The user has already created a list, and moved onto a later step of the user journey.

actionData.title: Goal Already Completed
actionData.message: The user has already added 2 tasks to lists, and moved onto a later step of the user journey.

actionData.title: User is on earlier goal
actionData.message: The user has not reached this goal. Try earlier goals.

actionData.title: Demo Action
actionData.message: If this was a real app, you could connect the 'Try Free Trial' button to your purchase experience.

pageSectionData.title: Create tasks to start organizing your life!

pageSectionData.bodyText:
This copy could explain to users how to add tasks, and the buttons below could deeplink into that UI in your app.

This modal UI is fully native, remotely updatable, and themeable.

actionData.title: Demo Action
actionData.message: If this was a real Todo list app, you could connect the button tap to your 'Add Task to List' experience with a deeplink.

pageSectionData.title: Try Pro to get even more!

pageSectionData.bodyText:
This UI should explain the benefits of the Pro plan, and allow the user to purchase a subscription. You can write your own, or use our modal UI system.

This modal UI is fully native, remotely updatable, and themeable.

actionData.title: User not currently at this goal
actionData.message:
The user has either already completed this goal, or not yet reached this stage of the user journey.

Try earlier or later demos steps.

actionData.title: User Action Simulated
actionData.message:
We've simulated the user completeing this action.

The state of the system has updated as the user is further along their user journey.

The evaluation demos may now produce different results.

pageSectionData.bodyText:
Your app is out of date.

We suggest updating in the app store for the best expereince

We're currently expereincing a temporary issue with our service.

Your data is safe.

Our team is hard at work and we we expect to have it resovled soon.

actionData.body: New Feature: Explore Collaboration Tools â†’
New EU data regulations. Learn how we protect your data â†’

actionData.title: Enjoying Critical Moments?
actionData.message:
If youâ€™re enjoying Critical Moments, we would greatly appreciate an app review!

If you are having an issue, our Help Docs and support team are here to help!

actionData.title: Review Critical Moments
actionData.message:
â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…

This isn't a real review prompt as this demo app is distributed via TestFlight, but it would work in a real app.

actionData.body: Welcome to critical moments! App wide banners can give your users crucial information.

Welcome to critical moments! App wide banners can give your users crucial information. This one happens to be really really long, and will probably be truncated eventually. It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity, it was the season of light, it was the season of darkness, it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair
This banner has a custom theme+action set in config. Tap me!
This banner will appear at the top! Any banner can specify top or bottom position.
This banner will appear at the bottom! Any banner can specify top or bottom position.
You are stuck with me... unless you use the "Clear all banners" action

This message will truncate after the first line, unlike the default of 4 lines. This message is also very very very long so the truncation is visible on iPads, which can be wide, and require run-on sentences.

pageSectionData.bodyText:
You've updated the default theme for the demo app.

Explore other demos like modals and banners to see how the theme impacts Critical Moments UI.

You can reset to the system theme using the option at the top of the Themes demo screens.

actionData.title: A simple notice alert
actionData.message: Title, message, okay button. You get the idea!

actionData.title: A cancelable alert
actionData.message:
An alert with a cancel button... not exactly rocket science.

Try both buttons to see what they do.

actionData.title: Action sheet deep dive
actionData.message:
This is an action sheet with several options.

Each can launch a custom action!

actionData.title: Lots of options
actionData.message: This is an alert with several buttons of different styles.

actionData.title: Nested Action
actionData.message:
Your last action/tap was linked to this alert action entirely through config. Pretty cool!

You could link many other actions here instead of an alert including showing a infomation sheet, deeplinking into part of your app, launching Safari with a link or nothing at all!

actionData.condition: /* Device condition checks we suggest for almost all apps */ device_battery_level > 0.2 &&  !device_low_power_mode &&  has_active_network &&  !low_data_mode && device_orientation != 'face_up' &&  device_orientation != 'face_down' &&  foreground &&   /* Optional device checks. You decide if these make sense for your app */ !other_audio_playing &&  !on_call &&  !has_car_audio &&  /* Check last prompt time was not in last 21 days. Note: this uses the 'ask_for_review' action we fire below.  */ (   eventCount('ask_for_review') == 0 || latestEventTime('ask_for_review') < now() - duration('504h') ) &&  /* Check the app wasn't installed in last week */ app_install_date < now() - duration('168h') &&  /* Check their app version isn't too old. Comment out until you have old clients you no longer want to request reviews on */ /* versionGreaterThan(app_version, '2.4.0') && */  /* Check the app version isn't in the 'known buggy versions' list. Commented out until you have versions you wish to add. */ /* app_version not in ['buggy_version_1', 'buggy_version_2'] && */  /* Out of date OS check */ !versionLessThan(os_version, '16.0') &&  /* only prompt users who's native language is supported in your UI. Uncomment once you set the correct values in the list. */ /* locale_language_code IN ['en', 'es', 'de'] && */  /* Trailing true to make editing this template easier, as lines above end in '&&' */ true

actionData.title: Condition True
actionData.message:
The condition was evaluated, and was true.

Try changing your device's state to make it false, then tap again.

actionData.title: Condition False
actionData.message:
The condition was evaluated, and was false.

Try changing your device's state to make it true, then tap again.
